Q1.Question: What do I need to take with me to vote?
Q1.Info: Your Permanent Voter's Card is your only ticket to vote, without it, you will not be allowed to vote. Make sure you take it with you to vote.

Q2.Question: What times does voting start and end??
options: voting can be done all day
Q2.Info: Make sure you get to your polling unit on time (between 8am and 2pm) otherwise you will not be allowed to vote. Only those that are already on the voting que will be allowed to vote after 2pm.

Q3.Question: Where should I do on ariving at my polling unit??
options: joing the voting que at my polling station
joing the voting que at any polling station
wait for my name to be called
Q3.Info: This election, voting and accreditation will be done simultamneoulsy. Therefore on arrival join the que to vote at your voting station.

Q4.Question: When I've been verified and handed a ballot paper, how do I cast a valid vote?
options: stain a finger with ink and mark the section on the ballot paper for my preferred candidate
use a pen to tick or sign on the section on the ballot paper for my preferred candidate,
stain a finger with ink and mark as many choices as possible
Q4.Info: Make sure you use your finger to mark the section provided on the ballot paper for your candidate/party. Marking multiple sections, or leaving the ballot paper empty will result in an invalid vote.

Q5.Question: To make sure my vote counts, it should be similar to?
Q5.Info: Mark your choice correctly to make sure you vote counts.

Q6.Question: What should I do with my ballot paper after I've marked my choice?
options: hand it to the nearest INEC official
leave it at the polling booth
fold it vertically with the printed side inwards, and drop it in the ballot box
Q6.Info: This election, voting and accreditation will be done simultamneoulsy. Therefore on arrival join the que to vote at your voting station.

Q7.Question: My rights as a voter on election day include?
options: right to access my polling station
right to receive information on the voting procedures from the poll officials
right to campaign for my candidate/party of choice
Q7.Info: Remember to vote peacefully, and remeber everyone has a right to vote for their candidate/party of choice.

Final:
Don’t sell your VOTE
Don’t sell your PVC
Don’t sell your CONSCIENCE
Don’t sell your FUTURE
